content.description:
Proximo anno, Domine, gravissima valetudinevaletudo, -inis, f.: health, illness usqueusque, adv.: all the way (to) ad 
periculum vitae vexatus iatralipteniatralipten = acc. sing. assumpsiassumo, -ere, -sumpsi: to hire; cuius 
sollicitudinisollicitudo, -inis, f.: concern et studio tuae tantum indulgentiaeindulgentia, -ae, f.: kindness beneficio 
referre gratiam parem possum. Quarequare, adv.: therefore rogo des ei civitatem 

Romanam... Vocatur ipse Harpocras, patronam habuit 
Thermuthin TheonisThermuthin Theonis = acc. of Thermuthis, daughter of Theon, quae iam pridemiam pridem, adv.: for a long time now defuncta estdefungor, -i, -functus sum = morior, -i.

Epistulae 10.5
content.question:
Answer the following question(s) in English unless the question specifically asks you to provide Latin words.

Identify what serious personal crisis Pliny describes in this passage.  

Provide the Latin word(s) that support your answer in Part (i).

Translate in context the Latin word(s) you cited in Part (ii).
